clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Workplace Food and Beverage Choices on Health and Wellness
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Workplace Food and Beverage Choices on Health and Wellness

lead_sponsor.agency: California Pacific Medical Center Research Institute

clinical_study.source: California Pacific Medical Center Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to determine if instituting a Healthy Beverage Initiative (HBI) at hospitals influences health and wellness of employees over a 12 month period.

detailed_description.textblock: To examine whether HBI is associated with decreased adiposity over a 12-month time period, in comparison to individuals identically assessed but not exposed to a HBI. Specifically, do those exposed to the HBI decrease in measures of adiposity, BMI, and sugar sweetened beverage (SSB) intake? Do they decrease more in those measures as compared to those not exposed to the HBI?

primary_outcome.description: Study participants at HBI campuses will show improvements (specifically, decreases) in indices of abdominal adiposity measured using waist circumference in centimeters.
Study participants at HBI campuses will show improvements (specifically, decreases) in indices of abdominal adiposity measured using sagittal abdominal diameter in centimeters.

secondary_outcome.description: Study participants at HBI campuses will show improvements (specifically, decreases) in body mass index [BMI] measured using height in centimeters and weight in kilograms to be calculated into BMI in kg/m^2.
Study participants at HBI campuses will show improvements (specifically, decreases) in SSB intake measured by the BEVQ (beverage food frequency questionnaire).

arm_group.description: A Healthy Beverage Initiative and health education will be implemented at two hospital campuses.
No change in beverages or education at two hospital campuses.

intervention.description: A Healthy Beverage Initiative will be instituted at two hospital campuses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The participant speaks and reads English.
- The participant consumes three or more sugar-sweetened beverages a week.
- The participant expects to be able to participate for all 3 visits (baseline, 6 months, and 12 months).
Exclusion Criteria:
The participant is planning an extended leave of absence and/or family medical leave of absence over the next 12 months.
